fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives:
Main EU initiatives, policies and legislative files currently followed by your organisation:  
 
Digital Single Market and all policy related initiatives including broadband, telecoms review, spectrum, 5G, OTT/platform regulation, industry digital transformation, cloud, data flows, big data, IoT, AI, among others. 
 
Proposal for a European Electronic Communications Code  
 
Spectrum allocation / harmonisation measures  
 
Cyber security, including implementation of Network Information Security Directive and review of the EU Cybersecurity Strategy 
 
Implementation of General Data Protection Regulation 
 
Review of Privacy Shield and cross border transfer mechanisms 
 
Data Package, including ePrivacy Regulation and Building European Data Economy 
 
Activities under the Cloud Select Industry Group  
 
Policy initiatives around e-skills and Innovation, including Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition 
 
Application and enforcement of Net Neutrality Regulation, BEREC guidelines and implementing work  
 
Internet Governance 
 
Review of Export Controls Regulation  
 
EU trade strategy including trade developments in third countries and EU bilateral and multilateral trade negotiations, incl. TISA, EU-US trade  
 
Negotiations related to Brexit including negotiations on the future trade rules between the UK and the EU  
 
Competition Policy 
 
Standardization policy, including IPR-related aspects 
 
Circular economy package, WEEE, RoHs, REACH, Eco-design, and other energy efficiency and environmental initiatives 
 
International and digital taxation  
 
Policy initiatives around Innovation, R&D in ICT 
 
Next MFF, broadband and digital services funding
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Cisco belongs to the following Trade Associations: 
 
Digital Europe:  http://www.digitaleurope.org/ 
 
American Chamber of Commerce to the EU: http://www.amchameu.eu/ 
 
European Internet Forum: http://eifonline.org/ 
 
European Telecommunication Network Operators: https://www.etno.eu/ 
 
Transatlantic Business Council: http://www.transatlanticbusiness.org/ 
 
Friends of Europe: http://www.friendsofeurope.org/ 
 
Fair Standards Alliance: http://www.fair-standards.org/ 
 
Alliance for Internet of Things Innovation: http://www.aioti.eu 
 
Bitkom: https://www.bitkom.org/
goals__remit:
Cisco designs, manufactures and sells Internet protocol (IP), based Internet products and services related to communications and information technology industries. Our customers include businesses of all sizes, public institutions, telecommunications companies, other service providers and individuals. We were incorporated in California in December 1984 and our headquarter is in San Jose, California. Our products and technologies are grouped into the following categories: switching; next generation routing; service provider video; collaboration; data center; wireless; security; and other products. As part of our business focus on the network as the platform of all forms of communications and IT, are products and services designed to help our customers use technology to address their business imperatives and opportunities – driving growth, improving productivity, reducing costs, mitigating risk and gaining competitive advantage. 
Cisco is present in all 28 Member States.
